title: Trump Fuels Fear Among Immigrant Farm Workers in California’s Central Valley
summary: The fertile valley feeds the world. President Trump has thrown farmers and farmworkers there into turmoil, but recently offered them a glimmer of hope.

title: How El Salvador Is Reaping Rewards From Trump’s Deportation Agenda
summary: In exchange for jailing more than 200 deportees, El Salvador’s president, Nayib Bukele, has become a favorite of the Trump administration.

title: L.A.-Area Bishop Excuses Faithful From Mass Over Fear of Immigration Raids
summary: Bishop Alberto Rojas of the Diocese of San Bernardino lifted the obligation for members to celebrate Mass if they had a “genuine fear of immigration enforcement actions.”

title: Some of Iran’s Enriched Uranium Survived Attacks, Israeli Official Says
summary: The assessment came as experts are trying to determine how long it would take Iran to rebuild its nuclear program in the aftermath of U.S. and Israeli strikes.

title: U.K. Faces Rising Threat From Iranian Plots, Intelligence Committee Says
summary: An official report warned that Iran was targeting dissidents and gathering intelligence on Jewish and Israeli targets in Britain.

title: A Reporter’s Trail From a Bush-Era Cyberattack to Trump’s Strike on Iran
summary: During the Obama administration, a Times reporter revealed details of a cyberattack on a nuclear enrichment center in Iran. He followed the story to the White House, and learned lessons critical to covering the recent bombing of Fordo and Natanz.

title: Texas City Racked by Floods Becomes a Hub for Search and Recovery
summary: Most summers, Kerrville, Texas, draws crowds for its July 4 celebration. This year, the streets are filled with emergency responders.

title: Discovery of Texas Flood Victims Slows After Nearly a Week of Searching
summary: Officials in Kerr County, the hardest-hit region, said the number of missing remained unchanged since Tuesday, at 161. The floods have killed at least 120 people statewide.

title: Rubio Tells Top Russian Diplomat of Trump’s Frustration Over Putin’s War
summary: The U.S. secretary of state met with his Russian counterpart on the sidelines of a gathering of Southeast Asian nations, where he also defended new U.S. tariff threats.

title: As Israel and Ukraine Advance Drone Warfare, U.S. Sees Its Own Vulnerabilities
summary: Israel and Ukraine have used drones against their adversaries in audacious ways that have helped the Pentagon see the need for new technology.

title: Russia Bombards Ukraine as U.S. Frustration Mounts
summary: Kyiv was the main target of an hourslong assault that killed at least two people, officials said. The barrage came hours before the top American and Russian diplomats met.

title: Ukrainian Intelligence Officer Is Shot to Death in Kyiv
summary: The victim’s unit played a key role in Ukraine’s surprise attack inside Russian territory last summer.

title: Trump Administration Is Forcing Prosecutors to Ignore Law, Whistle-Blower Says
summary: In an interview with The New York Times, a former Justice Department lawyer, Erez Reuveni, said officials pressed subordinates to mislead judges, and dared the courts to stop it.

title: Former Girl Bosses Are ‘Leaning Out’ to Redefine What Ambition Looks Like
summary: They reached the heights of corporate success. Now some women are trying to redefine what ambition looks like.

title: China Surveys Seabeds Where Naval Rivals May One Day Clash
summary: Chinese research ships are studying the seas for science and resources, but the data they gather could also be useful in a conflict with Taiwan or the United States.

title: Can the Next Fed Chair Truly Be Independent From Trump’s Influence?
summary: The president hasn’t named a successor to Jerome H. Powell, but his insistence on someone who will lower interest rates has already raised doubts about their credibility.

title: Trump Pledges 50% Tariffs Against Brazil, Citing ‘Witch Hunt’ Against Bolsonaro
summary: Tensions between the United States and Brazil have suddenly burst open. Brazil’s president promised to reciprocate against President Trump’s tariffs.

title: Trump Threatens New Tariffs on Brazil and Copper: What to Know
summary: Since re-entering office, President Trump has announced a barrage of tariffs to try to rewire the global economy.

title: U.K. and France Agree to First-Ever Nuclear Weapons Pact to Fend Off Threat to Europe
summary: The leaders of the two countries confirmed details of a strengthened defense relationship at a summit Thursday. An agreement on tackling unauthorized migration was also announced.

title: A Lethal Israeli Airstrike Hits Near a Gaza Aid Clinic
summary: The attack struck near a facility run by an American aid organization as negotiators from Hamas and Israel wrangle over a potential new cease-fire agreement.

title: Israel Will Allow More Aid Into Gaza, Officials Say
summary: The decision followed discussions with the European Union, which has pressed Israel to ease the dire humanitarian conditions for Palestinians in the territory.

title: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on U.N. Special Rapporteur Francesca Albanese
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio denounced Francesca Albanese, a special rapporteur, for calling for international investigations of Americans and Israelis over the war in the enclave.

title: These Younger Democrats Are Sick of Their Party’s Status Quo
summary: Majority Democrats, a new group of elected officials from all levels of government, has outsized ambitions to challenge political orthodoxies and remake the party.

title: New Democratic Group Says Answer to the Party’s Woes Lies With the States
summary: The founders of the initiative, the States Forum, say they hope to extend successful Democratic policies across states and even to the national level.

title: La Scala Warns Opera Patrons: No Flip-Flops or Tank Tops Allowed
summary: Milan’s famed opera house is cracking down on the underdressed, even as it and other European opera companies try to attract a wider audience.

title: In Des Moines, Big Operas and Big Ambitions Fill a Tiny Theater
summary: Des Moines Metro Opera has become one of the country’s most successful smaller companies doing adventurous repertory in a 467-seat space.

title: Trolling Democracy
summary: The rise of a toxic online politics.

title: Jordan Peterson and I Had a Chat
summary: We had different ideas about what’s making men’s lives hard.

title: Vladimir Putin Messed Up
summary: We explain President Trump and Putin’s changing relationship.

title: The Original Birkin Sells for $10 Million
summary: A lively bidding war led to the Hermès prototype, which was created for the actress Jane Birkin, selling for far more than expected.

title: Signs of Violence in Mississippi County Sheriff’s Office Dated Back Years
summary: The F.B.I. and a Mississippi sheriff investigated complaints about brutal assaults, but the deputies accused remained on the force and never faced charges.

title: A.I.-Generated Images of Child Sexual Abuse Are Flooding the Internet
summary: Organizations that track the material are reporting a surge in A.I. images and videos, which are threatening to overwhelm law enforcement.

title: Maya Ruler’s Tomb Is Unearthed in Belize, With Clues to His Ancient World
summary: A rare mosaic death mask made of jadeite and vessels in the shapes of an owl, a monkey and coati-mundi were found with the ruler.
